<title level="1" right="Cantrip 1" pfs="">[Torturous Trauma](/Spells.aspx?ID=1270)</title>

<spoilers>May contain spoilers from Blood Lords</spoilers>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="Cantrip" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=22" />
<trait label="Necromancy" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=117" />
<trait label="Nonlethal" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=188" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Pathfinder #186: Ghost King's Rage](/Sources.aspx?ID=189) pg. 77</row>

**Traditions**
[Arcane](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=1), [Divine](/SpellLists.aspx?Tradition=2)

<row gap="medium">

<row gap="tiny">
<row>**Cast**</row>
<row><actions string="Two Actions" /></row>
<row>[somatic](/Rules.aspx?ID=283), [verbal](/Rules.aspx?ID=284)</row>
</row>

</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Range** 30 feet

**Target** 1 living creature
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Saving Throw** [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude

</row>

</column>

---

With this spell born of Kemnebi's sadistic love of torture, you batter a creature's internal organs, leaving no external signs of the immense pain you delivered. The target takes bludgeoning damage equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting modifier with a [basic](/Rules.aspx?ID=329) Fortitude save. If it critically fails, the target is also [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15) until the start of your next turn. Creatures that lack internal organs are unaffected by this spell.

---
**Heightened (+1)** The bludgeoning damage increases by 1d4.
name: Torturous Trauma
